meanings.definition: The act of making something strange or unusual.
meanings.sent1: Her weirding of the room with colorful lights created a magical atmosphere.
meanings.sent2: The weirding of the painting with abstract shapes intrigued the viewers.
meanings.sent3: The weirding of the cake with unexpected ingredients made it a surprising hit at the party.
meanings.sent4: His weirding of the traditional dance with modern moves brought a fresh energy to the performance.
meanings.sent5: The weirding of the garden with exotic plants transformed it into a mystical sanctuary.

meanings.definition: The state of being strange or unusual.
meanings.sent1: The weirding of the town was evident in its quirky architecture and eccentric residents.
meanings.sent2: She embraced the weirding of her personality and stood out in a crowd.
meanings.sent3: The weirding of the weather with sudden changes kept everyone on their toes.
meanings.sent4: In the quiet forest, the weirding of the silence felt eerie and unsettling.
meanings.sent5: The weirding of the night sky with shooting stars was a mesmerizing sight.
